citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The facility was unable to provide a written program of veterinary care at the time of inspection. The written program of
veterinary care assures that staff understand emergency procedures and authorized veterinary care protocols to ensure
animal welfare, and is examined at the time of inspection to ensure the authority of the attending veterinarian. The facility
must ensure that the written program of veterinary care is available at the time of inspection.
Correct by March 19, 2024.

The bottom of the metal frame on the side of the main entrance door to the aviary was rusted (@3x6 inches), with sharp
edges partially covered by duct tape that the birds had pulled off and damaged. Sharp rusted edges of metal may present
an injury or ingestion hazard, and the duct tape may be harmful to welfare if ingested. The facility must ensure that
housing facilities are kept in good repair and protect the animals from injury.
Correct by March 18, 2024.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
A black, sticky and wet substance was evident at the bottom junction of the walls and floor at almost the entire internal
circumference of the aviary, and white staining on upper wire walls at the front of the aviary indicated excreta had not
been removed. Improper sanitization of enclosures allows accumulation of dirt, debris, excreta and other disease hazards.
The facility must ensure that sanitation occurs as often as necessary.
Correct by March 13, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.126(a)(2) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
The facility was unable to provide a written program of veterinary care at the time of inspection. The written program of 
veterinary care assures that staff understand emergency procedures and authorized veterinary care protocols to ensure 
animal welfare, and is examined at the time of inspection to ensure the authority of the attending veterinarian. The facility 
must ensure that the written program of veterinary care is available at the time of inspection. 
 
Correct by March 19, 2024. 
3.153(a)(1)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The bottom of the metal frame on the side of the main entrance door to the aviary was rusted (@3x6 inches), with sharp 
edges partially covered by duct tape that the birds had pulled off and damaged. Sharp rusted edges of metal may present 
an injury or ingestion hazard, and the duct tape may be harmful to welfare if ingested. The facility must ensure that 
housing facilities are kept in good repair and protect the animals from injury. 
 
Correct by March 18, 2024. 
3.158(b)(1) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
A black, sticky and wet substance was evident at the bottom junction of the walls and floor at almost the entire internal 
circumference of the aviary, and white staining on upper wire walls at the front of the aviary indicated excreta had not 
been removed. Improper sanitization of enclosures allows accumulation of dirt, debris, excreta and other disease hazards. 
The facility must ensure that sanitation occurs as often as necessary. 
 
Correct by March 13, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
